body: $BABA $NVDA $AAPL $NIO   I ordered 5 items once from Alabama and let me just say it was the worst experience I've ever had and I can't imagine it's a great store for anyone.. Took 2 months to get  My purchase. The little jacket I bought the Hoodie was so small that I pushed my head down when I put the  it on,  Because it was so small looked funny hanging behind my back. was made it more for a child not an adult even though it was X-large and said nothing about being for a child.  Both shoes were cheap and  I gave them away to goodwill. There was nothing I was able to keep from that order luckily it only costs me a $120

message.body: $BABA, $NIO we are clearly under attack of US and Chinese governments, the silly China, instead of helping their companies, they are putting more regulations, I was a big believer in $BABA and $NIO, now I feel I made the wrong choice, market up, they go down, market down, they crash. The problem, investors are leaving those stocks to buy high valuation stocks like $AAPL, $NVDA and so on...

@Oliwood @Rucer517 @ShantP21 @AllJackedUp @Jamz83 @M_89 @Uncle_Covid @denseanddumb @grifmaster @Stock__Twists 

$QQQ $SPY $IWM $AAPL   

Apple  has closed its major New York City retail stores to indoor traffic because of surging #COVID-19 cases, Bloomberg reports, although customers can pick up online orders at the stores.

The move affects 16 stores across the city, including Upper West Side, West 14th Street, Staten Island and Bronx locations, but the move falls short of the complete shuttering of stores the company has done previously to slow the spread of the virus.
Shoppers will not be allowed to enter the stores to browse or purchase anything onsite, and technical support from the Genius Bar is not available.

Apple has temporarily shut several stores in recent weeks, including locations in California, Florida, Georgia, Ohio, Texas and D.C., as it tries to cope with the #omicron variant.

https://seekingalpha.com/news/3783525-covid-spike-shuts-apples-nyc-stores-to-shoppe
